title: Substack CEO Chris Best Doesn’t Realize He’s Just Become The Nazi Bar

last_post.content: One of the incredibly frustrating things reading the transcript of Nilay's interview with the Substack guy (H/T @mmasnick) is seeing the proprietor of a private platform arguing that "freedom of speech" means that private platforms shouldn't moderate speech. The whole point of Section 230, and arguably of the First Amendment, is to put that right in the hands of private platforms in the hope that they will constructively help structure discourse. https://www.techdirt.com/2023/04/14/substack-ceo-chris-best-doesnt-realize-hes-just-become-the-nazi-bar/

title: knightcolumbia.org/events/opti...

last_post.content: At @knightcolumbia I'm co-organizing what I think is the first symposium on the topic of algorithmic amplification on social media — April 28/29 (NYC and online). I'm told we have over 600 registrations already. We'll be moving to a waitlist for in-person participation soon. Register to hear from ~30 leading thinkers on the topic: https://knightcolumbia.org/events/optimizing-for-what-algorithmic-amplification-and-society

title: Design notes on the 2023 Wikipedia redesign

last_post.content: Some nice design and prototyping notes from Alex Hollender on the latest Wikipedia redesign. This is some tough, under-the-radar work! https://alexhollender.com/wikipedia-2023-redesign

title: The End of Computer Magazines in America

last_post.content: I am sorry to report that the last two publications recognizable as computer magazines in the classic sense have abandoned print. (You probably didn’t notice unless you were a subscriber.) I was moved to write a eulogy for the whole era. https://www.technologizer.com/2023/04/15/the-end-of-computer-magazines-in-america/

title: Pre-order 50 Years of Text Games: From Oregon Trail to A.I. Dungeon on BackerKit

last_post.content: A very special package from my book printer: the final versions of each edition of "50 Years of Text Games" !!! I celebrated by replacing the mockups on the pre-order store with actual photos (https://50-years-of-text-games.backerkit.com/hosted_preorders/). If a gorgeous 600+ page book about the history of interactive fiction sounds good to you (and you missed the crowdfunding campaign last year), there's still time left to pre-order, but not much-- these editions will likely be sold out by summer.

title: imaging-neuroscience.org/Annou...

last_post.content:
Following Elsevier's decision to raise the article processing charge for NeuroImage to $3,450, all editors (inc. chief editors) from NeuroImage and NeuroImage:Reports have resigned, effective immediately.

I am joining this action and have also resigned.

Full announcement: https://imaging-neuroscience.org/Announcement.pdf

title: Heri Mulyo Cahyo

last_post.content:
Well, fuck. The GPT disinformation age is now.

I googled "OS for 4gb ram" and the first hit, which also was used by google to populate its snippet is an answer from quora which is very obviously created with #chatgpt (I recognised the non-committal non-answer right away, but it can also be detected by a popular GPT detector).

The user has 98 answers and, you've guessed it, they are all created with GPT.
PLOT TWIST: The questions where also created with GPT!

https://www.quora.com/profile/Heri-Mulyo-Cahyo

#AI

title: https://doi.org/10.1093/jcmc/zmad002

last_post.content:
The vast, vast majority of attempts to build communities online (open source projects, wikis, subreddits, etc.) don't really go anywhere. Very few get more than a few contributions from a few contributors. Why do so many fail?

🧵 about our newly published paper (with @aaronshaw and @mako)

https://doi.org/10.1093/jcmc/zmad002

title: Majority of Americans aren’t confident in the safety and reliability of cryptocurrency

last_post.content:
a lot of headlines are focusing on the 75% number, but it's most startling to me that 6% of US adults familiar with crypto think that the current ways to trade crypto are "very" or "extremely" reliable and safe

i feel like even most crypto true believers don't feel that way lol

(this is from pew's latest crypto study: https://www.pewresearch.org/fact-tank/2023/04/10/majority-of-americans-arent-confident-in-the-safety-and-reliability-of-cryptocurrency/)

title: cbsnews.com/miami/news/florida...

last_post.content:
Florida is getting real scary real fast. They will now allow death penalty sentences with an 8-4 jury vote instead of unanimous, they’ve passed a bill to make sex crimes against children punishable by death, and they’re working to make being trans near children a sex crime. For all the “it could never happen here” folks, we’re inching closer to state sanctioned mass murder all the time.

title: In counties with more Black doctors, Black people live longer, ‘astonishing’ study finds

last_post.content:
"The new study found that Black residents in counties with more Black physicians — whether or not they actually see those doctors — had lower mortality from all causes, and showed that these counties had lower disparities in mortality rates between Black and white residents. The finding of longer life expectancy persisted even in counties with a single Black physician."

https://www.statnews.com/2023/04/14/black-doctors-primary-care-life-expectancy-mortality/

""Most importantly however: the fediverse is a movement, presently engaged in the woefully under-reported fight for an equitable and just internet, and it needs the champions...in its corner to stand a chance of winning.

What we *civilians* need from you at this time is your attendance at the gathering space....

Grow the garden-like town square together with everyone else."

title: How AI-powered tools like ChatGPT can combat ADHD paralysis

last_post.content:
So I have ADHD, and kept seeing praise for chatGPT on reddit from those who were using it to organize tasks and overcome paralysis. I looked into it - my test was creating a firbolg cleric for a dnd campaign - and...it really helped! As an aide for overcoming procrastination, it's honestly kind of great.

And then, it wasn't. When I pushed the tool to help me find sources for deeper research, it appeared to fabricate a scholarly journal.


You can read it here: https://mashable.com/article/chatgpt-ai-and-adhd

title: Systems design 2: What we hope we know

title: Scripting News: Friday, April 14, 2023

last_post.content:
The journalism industry needs to create a single place to get news headlines from their industry. They never should have let the tech industry run this, for reasons that should now be obvious.

http://scripting.com/2023/04/14.html

title: biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/20...

last_post.content:
I'm going to be absolutely haranguing people at bbqs with this knowledge for the rest of my life.

"For millennia, humans have watched nocturnal insects flying erratically around fires and lamps. … Under sky light, tilting the dorsum towards the brightest visual hemisphere helps maintain proper flight attitude and control. Near artificial sources, however, this highly conserved dorsal-light-response can produce continuous steering around the light and trap an insect."

https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.04.11.536486v1

title: e-rara.ch/bau_1/content/zoom/2...

last_post.content:
The Haas Type Foundry in Switzlerand was in business for 200 years before Neue Haas Grotesk and Helvetica were released. A year or two, I paid the University Library in Basel to digitize a 775-page type specimen volume from Haas in the 1860s. Now, the digitization is online for everyone to enjoy (not just me). Thank goodness!

https://www.e-rara.ch/bau_1/content/zoom/26597547

title: How does spam protection work on Stack Exchange?

last_post.content:
What are some design patterns in machine learning systems?

Here are a few I've seen:

1. Cascade: Break a complex problem into simpler problems. Each subsequent model focuses on more difficult or specific problems.

Stack Exchange has a cascade of defenses against spam: https://stackoverflow.blog/2020/06/25/how-does-spam-protection-work-on-stack-exchange/

title: An open letter to organisations engaging with the online blind community. Twitter has abandoned us, many of us have abandoned Twitter, join us on Mastodon

title: American billionaires almost a third richer today than when pandemic hit: report

last_post.content:
American billionaires almost a third richer today than when pandemic hit: report.

As the deadline for Americans to file federal income tax returns fast approaches, Oxfam America on Friday renewed calls for taxing the ultrarich while publishing an analysis showing America's growing number of billionaires saw their wealth increase by nearly one-third since the start of the Covid-19 pandemic and by nearly 90% over the past decade. https://www.rawstory.com/us-billionaires-almost-a-third-richer-today-than-when-hit-report/

title: Florida to allow death penalty with 8-4 jury vote instead of unanimously

last_post.content:
Florida is getting real scary real fast. They will now allow death penalty sentences with an 8-4 jury vote instead of unanimous, they’ve passed a bill to make sex crimes against children punishable by death, and they’re working to make being trans near children a sex crime. For all the “it could never happen here” folks, we’re inching closer to state sanctioned mass murder all the time.

https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/florida-to-allow-death-penalty-with-8-4-jury-vote-instead-of-unanimously/ar-AA19S7Fh

https://www.cbsnews.com/miami/news/florida-house-backs-death-penalty-in-child-rapes/

https://translegislation.com/bills/2023/FL
